Comments_List: I developed a thorough understanding of the impact investing space, and learned how to work in teams and be successful in a consulting engagement.
I learned so much about impact investment, private equity, and development impact measurement!

The course forces the team to work together and create concrete deliverables from an oftentimes amorphous or ambiguous assignment. Organization and long-term strategy are necessary for success in the project  it cannot be put off until the end of the term.
Project Design, Research, Impact Investing, Impact measurement, understanding of the IFC and other private investment bodies

The Global capstone is always a hit or miss - I found that my class went well because our project was clearly defined from the start, and our team got along well. More time to work in-class on our deliverable would have been nice.
The client was engaged, and gave good direction from the start. The structure of the project enabled the team to work together and develop concrete deliverables over the course of the semester.

Strengths
Learn how to work well with a team on a long term project
Very interesting material

If you get the chance, take this capstone! Professor Hopkins was the absolute best capstone facilitator. He is also a phenomenal person and really cares about the students. He wants us to learn and truly take something away from the class. Overall, this capstone was much better than some of the others I heard about. We had a clear deliverable, it was an interesting project, we had a reasonable client (the IFC), and our professor was great.
Pick your capstone based on the professor. Bo is a great instructor and I would highly recommend the class with him.

Take Bo's capstone! He is great at organizing the course so that you don't feel you're not grounded. He found us an amazing client (the IFC) with a great and well-structured requirement. I had a phenomenal time working on this project and learned SO MUCH.
I have heard horror stories of capstone projects, this was not one such capstone. It was a joy to work with the IFC and with Professor Hopkins.
